page.title: 13Housing
page.content: The Sun Inn was built about the 16th or 17th century.When Mr.Mc.Guffie owned the Sun Inn in 1921,it used to a pig, cow and hen farm. Now Mr. Guarricino, who is Italian, has been the landlord for nearly 14 years. Before the bridge was built, there was a wath over Halls beck. All the near_ by houses had steps going down to the beck. On the Village Green there used to be a Moot Hall. Hill Farm has a spinning gallery up stairs. Ashness Cottage was the first post office in the village. Clare's house used to be a joiner's. The house down the road was a tailor's. In 1985, there are fifteen Council houses,but some have been bought by occupiers. No new buildings are allowed without planning permission. Many older houses are being bought for holiday homes.
